name: Who Am I?  [2] Multiple Choice Quiz | Soccer | 25 Questions

questions.text: Sporting Lisbon - Barcelona - Real Madrid?
questions.explanation:
Luis Figo.

	Figo joined Real Madrid from rivals Barcelona in a world record fee.

questions.text: FC Koln - Rapid Vienna - Bayern Munich - Udinese?
questions.explanation:
Carsten Jancker.

	Jancker signed for Udinese from Bayern Munich in 2002.

questions.text: Paris Saint Germain - Arsenal - Real Madrid - Paris Saint Germain - Liverpool (Loan)- Manchester City?
questions.explanation:
Nicolas Anelka.

	Anelka had caused bitter feelings towards the Arsenal supporters by walking out on them to join Real Madrid, where he played just 19 times and scored 2 goals.

questions.text: Dinamo Kiev - AC Milan?
questions.explanation:
Andriy Shevchenko.

	Shevchenko scored 24 goals in each of his first two seasons at Milan.

questions.text: Leeds United - Peterborough United - Birmingham City - Queens Park Rangers - Arsenal - Manchester City?
questions.explanation:
David Seaman.

	Seaman spent one season at Elland Road before being offloaded.

questions.text: Castellon - Valencia - Valencia 'B' - Valencia - Lazio - Barcelona (Loan) - Middlesbrough (Loan)?
questions.explanation:
Gaizka Mendieta.

	Mendieta spent most of his career at Valencia before signing for Lazio in season 2001-02.

questions.text: University de Chile - River Plate - Lazio - Juventus?
questions.explanation:
Marcelo Salas.

	Salas nearly joined Manchester United before signing for Lazio, then scored against them in the 1999 European Super Cup.

questions.text: Watford - Liverpool - Aston Villa - West Ham United - Manchester City?
questions.explanation:
David James.

	David James was England's goalkeeper during Euro 2004.

questions.text: Fortuna Dusseldorf - SV Hamburg - Glasgow Rangers - SV Hamburg?
questions.explanation:
Jorg Albertz.

	Albertz has the nickname 'The Hammer' because of his fierce shot.

questions.text: RBC Roosendaal - NAC - Glasgow Celtic - Nottingham Forest - Vitesse Arnhem - Benfica - Feyenoord?
questions.explanation:
Pierre van Hooijdonk.

	van Hooijdonk 'went on strike' to get out of his contract with Nottingham Forest. He said the team 'was not good enough' to stay in the FA Premier League once promoted.

questions.text: Lazio - Ternana - Lazio - Juventus - Napoli - Juventus - AC Milan - Glasgow Celtic - Sheffield Wednesday - West Ham United - Charlton Athletic?
questions.explanation:
Paolo Di Canio.

	A man of immense talent, Di Canio has never played for his native country, Italy.

questions.text: Perugia - Avellino - Casertana - Avellino - Reggiana - Juventus - Middlesbrough - Marseilles - Lazio - Derby County?
questions.explanation:
Fabrizio Ravanelli.

	Ravanelli's nickname is 'The White Feather'.

questions.text: Hyeres - Meaux - Laval - Strasbourg - Chelsea - Marseilles?
questions.explanation:
Frank LeBoeuf.

	Chelsea lost a valuable member of the team when LeBoeuf left. He hardly ever plays a bad game for anyone.

questions.text: Den Bosch - Heerenveen - PSV Eindhoven - Manchester United?
questions.explanation:
Ruud van Nistelrooy.

	van Nistelrooy has been outstanding for Manchester United during his first season at Old Trafford. He was the third player since George Best to score 20 league goals in a season.

questions.text: Ajax Amsterdam - FC Twente - Ajax Amsterdam - Barcelona - Glasgow Rangers?
questions.explanation:
Ronald de Boer.

	Ronald's brother Frank stayed at Barcelona when Ronald moved to Rangers.

questions.text: Borussia Monchenglanbach - Bayern Munich - Fiorentina - Borussia Monchengladbach - Bayern Munich - Wolfsburg?
questions.explanation:
Stefan Effenberg.

	Effenberg, although sometimes outspoken, was an integral part of the Bayern Munich team, until moving to Wolfsburg in 2002.

questions.text: Budocnost - Partizan Belgrade - Valencia - Real Madrid - Fiorentina- Levante?
questions.explanation:
Predrag Mijatovic.

	Mijatovic was the star of the now defunct Italian side Fiorentina.

questions.text: Ermis Amyuntaiou - Pontoi Veroias - Olympiakos - Newcastle United?
questions.explanation:
Nikos Dabizas.

	The linchpin of Bobby Robson's defence at Newcastle.

questions.text: Arsenal - Bradford City (Loan) - Arsenal - Middlesbrough - Aston Villa - Portsmouth?
questions.explanation:
Paul Merson.

	Merson has led a troubled life during his football career with addiction to Alcohol, drugs and gambling.

questions.text: Leeds United - Oldham Athletic - Manchester United - Wolverhampton Wanderers?
questions.explanation:
Denis Irwin.

	Irwin was Sir Alex Ferguson's 'Mr. Reliable' and played over 500 games for Manchester United between 1990-2002.

questions.text: Ceske Budejovice - Viktoria Zizkov - Slavia Prague - Manchester United - Benfica - Lazio - Sparta Prague?
questions.explanation:
Karel Poborsky.

	Poborsky never shined at Old Trafford and was sold after just 2 seasons.

questions.text: Sporting Lisbon - West Ham United (Loan) - Ajax Amsterdam - Benfica - Atletico Madrid?
questions.explanation:
Dani.

	West Ham had the chance of signing Dani, but amazingly never took up the offer for the talented forward.

questions.text: St. Mirren - Motherwell - Borussia Dortmund - Glasgow Celtic?
questions.explanation:
Paul Lambert.

	Some commentators believe that Labert was one of the main reasons why Rangers domination had come to an end.

questions.text: Manchester United - Aston Villa - Manchester United - Chelsea?
questions.explanation:
Mark Bosnich.

	Manchester United have let Bosnich go for free twice. The first time was work permit problems, and the second he was released from his contract.

questions.text: Manchester United - Barcelona - Bayern Munich (Loan) - Manchester United - Chelsea - Southampton - Everton - Blackburn Rovers?
questions.explanation:
Mark Hughes.

	'Sparky' as he is known, scored twice in a European Cup-Winners Cup final against Barcelona for Manchester United.
